docs.lead_paragraph: The search for a better chemical agent to block the heroin addict's euphoric "high" will be intensified with a $100,000 Ford Foundation grant and $284,000 in city funds.

headline.main: Six Projects Started to Develop Nonaddictive Heroin Substitute

docs.abstract: NYC Health Services Admr Chase announces that Ford Foundation has granted $100,000 and city funds of $284,000 will be used in 6 research projects designed to improve effectiveness of so-called antagonist drugs cyclazocine and naloxone in treating heroin addicts; says that unlike methadone, both drugs are nonaddictive; details
docs.snippet: The search for a better chemical agent to block the heroin addict's euphoric "high" will be intensified with a $100,000 Ford Foundation grant and $284,000 in city funds.
